SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.magnos.io.bytes
Class ByteReader

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.io.bytes.ByteReader

public class ByteReader
extends java.lang.Object

A detailed reader of a BufferStream. This reader will read exactly what was placed in the BufferStream by a ByteWriter. Both the ByteReader and ByteWriter will accept null arguments since each nullable object writes a boolean for whether it is null or not. If the null byte is false a null object is returned, if the null byte was true the object that was written is returned. A reader can also read beyond the length of its BufferStream. If the reader goes beyond the ByteReader all numbers will be returned 0, all objects returned will be null, and the isValid() method will return false.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Nested Class Summary
static interface ByteReader.ReadCallback<T>
          A callback to unserialize an object from a ByteReader.

Constructor Detail

ByteReader

public ByteReader(BufferStream stream)
Instantiates a new ByteReader.

Parameters:
stream - The stream to read from. This reader will only read on the data that exists in the stream when this reader is instantiated. In other words any data added to the stream will not be visible.
Method Detail

getStream

public BufferStream getStream()
Returns the underlying stream of this reader.

Returns:
The reference

size

public int size()
Returns the number of bytes remaining to read.

Returns:
The number of bytes to read.

isValid

public boolean isValid()
Returns whether this reader is valid.

Returns:
Whether the reader is valid. This is true unless a method is invoked which attempts to read more data than exists in the buffer. Once this is set to false all read operations will return 0, false, or null depending on the requested type.

skip

public void skip(int bytes)
Skips the given number of bytes in the reader. If the given number of bytes exceed the number of bytes remaining in this buffer, all data in the buffer will be skipped.

Parameters:
bytes - The number of bytes to read.

order

public java.nio.ByteOrder order()
Returns the byte order of the reader.

Returns:
The byte order of the reader.

order

public void order(java.nio.ByteOrder order)
Sets the byte order of the reader.

Parameters:
order - The new byte order of the reader.

sync

public void sync()
Syncs this reader with the underlying stream. All data that was read in this reader will be read from the stream, essentially skipping the number of total bytes read by this reader.

hasRemaining

public boolean hasRemaining()
Returns whether this reader has any data remaining.

Returns:
True if there's atleast 1 byte in the reader, otherwise false.

has

public boolean has(int bytes)
Returns whether this reader has atleast the number of give bytes.

Parameters:
bytes - The number of bytes to check for existence.
Returns:
True if the size() of this reader is >= bytes.

getBoolean

public boolean getBoolean()
Reads a boolean from the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough bytes to read a boolean false will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. A boolean takes up a single byte, a 0 for false and every other number means true.

Returns:
The boolean read from the underlying stream.

getBooleanArray

public boolean[] getBooleanArray()
Reads a boolean array from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. The original state of the array will be returned, if the array written to the stream was null, then null will be returned. If the array written to the stream was empty, then an empty array will be returned. This is accomplished by using the next boolean in the stream as a marker for whether the array is null. The next 2 bytes in the stream are used as an unsigned short (0-65535) to determine the number of elements in the array.

Returns:
The boolean array written to the stream, or null if the reader is invalid.

getBooleans

public boolean[] getBooleans(int count)
Reads a boolean array from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid, otherwise an array of the given size will be returned.

Parameters:
count - The size of the array to return.
Returns:
The boolean array read from the stream, or null if the read is invalid.

getBooleans

public boolean[] getBooleans(boolean[] bs)
Reads an array of booleans from the underlying stream into the given array. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid, otherwise the given array will be returned.

Parameters:
bs - The array to place the read booleans in.
Returns:
The given array or null if not enough data exists in the stream.

Reads a double from the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough bytes to read a double 0 will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. A double takes up 8 bytes.

Returns:
The double read from the underlying stream.

getDoubleArray

public double[] getDoubleArray()
Reads a double array from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. The original state of the array will be returned, if the array written to the stream was null, then null will be returned. If the array written to the stream was empty, then an empty array will be returned. This is accomplished by using the next boolean in the stream as a marker for whether the array is null. The next 2 bytes in the stream are used as an unsigned short (0-65535) to determine the number of elements in the array. A double takes up 8 bytes.

Returns:
The double array written to the stream, or null if the reader is invalid.

getDoubles

public double[] getDoubles(int count)
Reads an int array from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid, otherwise an array of the given size will be returned. A double takes up 8 bytes.

Parameters:
count - The size of the array to return.
Returns:
The int array read from the stream, or null if the read is invalid.

getDoubles

public double[] getDoubles(double[] bs)
Reads an array of doubles from the underlying stream into the given array. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid, otherwise the given array will be returned. A double takes up 8 bytes.

Parameters:
bs - The array to place the read doubles in.
Returns:
The given array or null if not enough data exists in the stream.

getBuffer

public void getBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer x)
Reads data from the underlying stream and places it in the given buffer. As much data as possible is copied over.

Parameters:
x - The buffer to place data into.

getString

public java.lang.String getString()
Reads a string from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. The original state of the string will be returned. If the string written to the stream was null, then null will be returned. If the string written to the stream was empty, then an empty string will be returned. This is accomplished by using the next boolean in the stream as a marker for whether the string is null. The next 2 bytes in the stream are used as an unsigned short (0-65535) to determine the number of characters in the string. A string takes up 1 byte as the null marker, an unsigned short for its length, and a byte for each of its characters.

Returns:
The string read from the stream, or null if the reader is invalid.

getString

public java.lang.String getString(int length)
Reads a string from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. A string is a byte for each of its characters.

Parameters:
length - The length of the string to read in characters.
Returns:
The string read from the stream, or null if the reader is invalid.

getStringArray

public java.lang.String[] getStringArray()
Reads a string array from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. The original state of the array will be returned, if the array written to the stream was null, then null will be returned. If the array written to the stream was empty, then an empty array will be returned. This is accomplished by using the next boolean in the stream as a marker for whether the array is null. The next 2 bytes in the stream are used as an unsigned short (0-65535) to determine the number of elements in the array. A string takes up 1 byte as the null marker, an unsigned short for its length, and a byte for each of its characters.

Returns:
The string array written to the stream, or null if the reader is invalid.

getUnicode

public java.lang.String getUnicode()
Reads a unicod string from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. The original state of the string will be returned. If the string written to the stream was null, then null will be returned. If the string written to the stream was empty, then an empty string will be returned. This is accomplished by using the next boolean in the stream as a marker for whether the string is null. The next 2 bytes in the stream are used as an unsigned short (0-65535) to determine the number of characters in the string. A unicode string takes up 1 byte as the null marker, an unsigned short for its length, and 2 bytes for each of its characters.

Returns:
The string read from the stream, or null if the reader is invalid.

getUnicode

public java.lang.String getUnicode(int length)
Reads a unicode string from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. A unicode string is 2 bytes for each of its characters.

Parameters:
length - The length of the string to read in characters.
Returns:
The string read from the stream, or null if the reader is invalid.

getUnicodeArray

public java.lang.String[] getUnicodeArray()
Reads a unicode string array from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. The original state of the array will be returned, if the array written to the stream was null, then null will be returned. If the array written to the stream was empty, then an empty array will be returned. This is accomplished by using the next boolean in the stream as a marker for whether the array is null. The next 2 bytes in the stream are used as an unsigned short (0-65535) to determine the number of elements in the array. A unicode string takes up 1 byte as the null marker, an unsigned short for its length, and 2 bytes for each of its characters.

Returns:
The long array written to the stream, or null if the reader is invalid.

If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid, otherwise the given array will be returned. A unicode string takes up 1 byte as the null marker, an unsigned short for its length, and 2 bytes for each of its characters.

getEnum

public <T extends java.lang.Enum<T>> T getEnum(java.lang.Class<T> type)
Reads an enum from the underlying stream of the give type. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. The original state of the enum will be returned, if the enum written to the stream was null, then null will be returned. The value of the enum is stored as an unsigned short, if the short read is not a valid enum ordinal then null is returned and this reader is marked invalid.

Type Parameters:
T - The enum type.
Parameters:
type - The class of the enum.
Returns:
The enum read from the stream or null if nout enough data exists in the stream.

getObject

public java.lang.Object getObject()
Reads an object from the underlying stream using deserialization. The object being read must be serializable or at least fit the requirements to be deserialized. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. The original state of the object will be returned, if the object written to the stream was null, then null will be returned.

Returns:
The object read from the stream or null if the reader is invalid.

getCastObject

public <T> T getCastObject()
Reads an object from the underlying stream using deserialization.

Type Parameters:
T - The type to cast the read object to.
Returns:
The object read from the stream or null if the reader is invalid.
See Also:
getObject()

getObject

public <T> T getObject(java.lang.Class<T> type)
Reads an object from the underlying stream using deserialization.

Type Parameters:
T - The type to cast the read object to.
Parameters:
type - The class of the object type to return.
Returns:
The object read from the stream or null if the reader is invalid.
See Also:
getObject()

getItem

public <T> T getItem(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                     ByteReader.ReadCallback<T> callback)
Reads an object from the underlying stream using a callback which serializes the object.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the read object.
Parameters:
type - The class of the object type to return.
callback - The callback to invoke to deserialize the object from the reader.
Returns:
The object read from the stream or null if the reader is invalid.

getArray

public <T> T[] getArray(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                        ByteReader.ReadCallback<T> callback)
Reads an array from the underlying stream. If not enough data exists in the stream null will be returned and this reader will be made invalid. The original state of the array will be returned, if the array written to the stream was null, then null will be returned. If the array written to the stream was empty, then an empty array will be returned. This is accomplished by using the next boolean in the stream as a marker for whether the array is null. The next 2 bytes in the stream are used as an unsigned short (0-65535) to determine the number of elements in the array.

Parameters:
type - The element type of the array.
callback - The callback to invoke to read each non-null element in the stream.
Returns:
The array written to the stream, or null if the reader is invalid.
